Intervention: Ginkgo Biloba: Patients take 120 mg daily (60 mg BID)
Placebo: patients will take 1 tablet BID
Eligibility: Intended standard dose of adjuvant chemotherapy with or without taxane
- Serum glutamate oxaloacetate transaminase (SGOT) does not exceed 1.5 times the upper limit of normal (ULN)
ALKALINE phosphatase not more than 1.5 times LSN
• Capable of completing questionnaires alone or with assistance
No diagnosis of psychiatric disorder in the last 5 years that would prevent compliance with the study
No known allergies to ginkgo biloba
Fertile patients should use effective contraception
More than 6 months since previous EGb761
No concomitant antithrombotic therapy (e.g., daily aspirin or anticoagulants)
• Anticoagulants used for the maintenance of central or peripheral lines (i.e. warfarin 1 mg/day or heparin) authorized
No concomitant aspirin or aspirin-like medicinal products (e.g., indomethacin, ibuprofen, or certain antihistamines, heparin or warfarin [except those used above])
No concomitant therapy should cause thrombocytopenia
No trazodone, monoamine oxidase inhibitors or concomitant thiazide diuretics (e.g. chlorothiazide, hydrochlorothiazide, indapamide or metolazone)
Results: The level of cognitive dysfunction measured by the overall score of the High Sensitivity Cognitive Screen (HCCS).

The primary analysis included the compilation of each subscale score for HSCS in the curve area (AUC) for base data points at the 12-month data point. The HSCS instrument contains questions about memory (0-39), language (0-30), visual motor (0-10), space (0-8), attention and concentration (0-25), self-regulation and planning (0-6) on variable scales.
Timeline: Baseline, 12 months after the start of chemotherapy.
Title of the arm/group: Ginkgo Biloba
Description of the arm/group: Ginkgo Biloba: Patients will take 120 mg daily (60 mg BID)
Unit of measurement: units on a scale*month Memory: 12.2 (9.18)
Description of the arm/group: Placebo: Patients will take 1 tablet BID
Unit of measure: units on a scale*month Memory: 12,6 (9,16)
Adverse Events: - Decrease in the number of neutrophils 4/104 (3.85%)
